definitions.definition: the fact that you no longer have something or have less of something:
examples: Many parents feel a sense of loss when their children leave home.

definitions.definition: a disadvantage caused by someone leaving or by something being taken away:
examples: It would be a great loss to the department if you left.
They never got over the loss of their son.

definitions.definition: a situation in which a business spends more money than it earns:
examples: The company announced a pre-tax loss of three million dollars.

definitions.definition: an occasion when a number of people die:
examples: The plane crashed with serious loss of life.
